Package world.ntdi.postglam.sql.module

Class Table

java.lang.Object
world.ntdi.postglam.sql.module.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents a table in a postgresql database.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table(Database database, String tableName, Map.Entry<String,DataTypes> primaryKey, LinkedHashMap<String,DataTypes> keys) throws SQLException
      Create a Table representation. This constructor will create a table with the given data if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      database - The database connection you want to use to create the table on
      tableName - The name of the table
      primaryKey - The primary key of the table
      keys - The rest of the columns you may want to have in your table
      Throws:
      SQLException - Will throw errors if trying to access closed statements/connections.

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public void insert(String primaryValue, String... values) throws SQLException
      Insert a row into the table. You should supply this method with the primary value and the rest of them. Example: Table#insert("12", "cat", "true"). This method will handle adding single quotes around values that require it when translated to SQL. Don't fear strings, SQL will translate them into the types they should be. NOTE: your values passed in should be the correct amount.
      Parameters:
      primaryValue - The primary key's value
      values - The rest of the values that will be inserted
      Throws:
      SQLException - Will throw errors if trying to access closed statements/connections

    • doesRowExist

      public boolean doesRowExist(String primaryValue) throws SQLException
      Check if a row exists before creating a new Row() object of it. This method just takes the value of a primary key and checks if it exists.
      Parameters:
      primaryValue - The value of the primary key
      Returns:
      If the row exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws errors if trying to access closed statements/connections

    • drop

      public void drop() throws SQLException
      Drop the table from the database. NOTE: This action is PERMANENT and there is no undo!
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws errors if trying to access closed statements/connections

    • deleteAllRows

      public void deleteAllRows() throws SQLException
      Delete all the rows in a table. NOTE: This action is PERMANENT and there is no undo!
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws errors if trying to access closed statements/connections

    • deleteAllRowsWhere

      public void deleteAllRowsWhere(String column, String value) throws SQLException
      Delete all the rows where a condition is met. This method uses the table's columns that you supplied when you first made it and searches for it. Then it used the passed value and removes all rows where the condition is met.
      Parameters:
      column - The name of the column that you're targeting for a condition
      value - The value of the column for the condition
      Throws:
      SQLException - Throws errors if trying to access closed statements/connections
